place.name: BARHOLM
place.gazetteerText: BARHOLM, a parish in Stamford district, Lincoln; on the Glen river, near the Great Northern railway, 2¾ miles SSE of Corby station, and 3½ WNW of Market Deeping. Post Town, Market-Deeping. Acres, 1,230. Real property, £1,876. Pop., 192. Houses, 42. The property is not much divided. The living is a vicarage, united with the vicarage of Stowe, in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £147. Patrons, the Trustees of Oakham and Uppingham schools. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
